document_data.name: Mong Ithal
document_data.mainbody: '''Mong Ithal''' was a chieftain of [[Clan Ithal]] during the [[First Age of Tethyr]].
document_data.Personality: Mong Ithal was a superb military leader and a skilled fighter, but he lacked the charisma to unite the many tribes of [[Tethyr]].
document_data.Relationships: Mong was the grandfather of Chief [[Clovis Ithal II (chieftain)|Clovis Ithal II]], who was in turn the father of [[Darrom Ithal]], who would become the first king of a unified Tethyr.
document_data.History: During the [[Battle for Calimaronn]] (later named [[Darromar]]) in the {{YearlinkName|-293}}, Warlord [[Karlag]] of the Tethyrian tribes was slain in combat. Mong Ithal took up the banner and continued the fight, beginning a siege against the garrison town that lasted for over a month. When the Calishite troops were finally defeated, both the town and the [[River Ith|river upon which it sat]] were renamed in honor of the victorious chieftain and his clan.
